did.head: Collection Overview
did.abstract: Diplomat. This small collection documents Harvey's service with the Department of State, 1930-1952. Materials include correspondence, Department of State memoranda, photographs, one speech (in French), and two articles.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Constance Ray Harvey graduated from Smith College in 1927. She began her diplomatic service in 1930 and held numerous diplomatic positions, serving as Vice Consul in Ottawa, Milan, Basel; Secretary of the Legation in Berne; Vice Consul at Lyon; and Consul in Zurich. She received the Medal of Freedom in 1947 for meritorious service with the French Underground, 1941-1942.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: This small collection documents Harvey's service with the Department of State, 1930-1952. Materials include correspondence, Department of State memoranda, photographs, one speech (in French), and two articles.
